reasons.reason: Regarding Claim 1, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses a method for providing a location based service in an electronic device, the method comprising: classifying location information of the electronic device having a similar characteristic into a category (paragraph 48); and mapping an operation of the electronic device according to the category (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 2, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the operation of the electronic device comprises at least one of control settings of the electronic device, execution of application programs, and an initial mode when an application program is executed.

Regarding Claim 3, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses a method for providing a location based service in an electronic device, the method comprising: detecting location information of the electronic device (paragraph 36); determining a category comprising the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 48); determining an operation of the electronic device, which is mapped to the category (paragraph 47); and performing the operation of the electronic device (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 4, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the performing of the operation of the electronic device comprises performing an operation recently performed in the category among a plurality of operations when the operation of the electronic device, which is mapped to the category, comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36 and 47).

Regarding Claim 5, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the performing of the operation of the electronic device comprises performing an operation having the most number of times the operation is performed in the category among a plurality of operations when the operation of the electronic device, which is mapped to the category, comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 6, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the performing of the operation of the electronic device comprises performing an operation having the most number of times the operation is performed in the category during a reference period among a plurality of operations when the operation of the electronic device, which is mapped to the category, comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 7, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses a method for providing a location based service in an electronic device, the method comprising: detecting location information of the electronic device when the electronic device performs a first operation (paragraph 36 and 48); determining a category comprising the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 48); and mapping the first operation of the category (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 8, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the mapping of the first operation comprises: determining a number of times the first operation is performed in the category; and mapping the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed is greater than or equal to a reference number of times (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 9, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the mapping of the first operation comprises: determining a number of times the first operation is performed during a reference period in the category; and mapping the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed in the category during the reference period in the category is greater than or equal to a reference number of times (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 10, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the mapping of the first operation comprises: determining a number of times a second operation is performed in the category when there is the second operation in the category; and mapping the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed in the category is greater than or equal to the number of times the second operation is performed in the category (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 11, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses detecting location information of the electronic device (paragraph 36); determining the category of the location information (paragraph 48); determining an operation mapped to the category (paragraph 47); and performing the operation (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 12, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses an electronic device comprising: a memory; and at least one processor configured to detect location information of the electronic device (paragraph 36), determine a category comprising the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 48), determine an operation of the electronic device mapped to the category (paragraph 47), and perform the operation (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 13, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to perform an operation recently performed in the category among a plurality of operations when the operation mapped to the category comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36 and 47).

Regarding Claim 14, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to perform an operation having the most number of times the operation is performed in the category among a plurality of operations when the operation mapped to the category comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 15, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to perform an operation having the most number of times the operation is performed in the category during a reference period among a plurality of operations when the operation mapped to the category comprises the plurality of operations (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 16, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses an electronic device comprising: a memory; and at least one processor configured to detect location information of the electronic device when performing a first operation (paragraph 36 and 47), determine a category comprising the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 48), and map the first operation to the category (paragraph 47).

Regarding Claim 17, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to determine a number of times the first operation is performed in the category and map the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed is greater than or equal to a reference number of times (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 18, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to determine a number of times the first operation is performed during a reference period in the category and map the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed in the category during the reference period in the category is greater than or equal to a reference number of times (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 19, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to determine a number of times a second operation is performed in the category when there is the second operation in the category and map the first operation to the category when the number of times the first operation is performed in the category is greater than or equal to the number of times the second operation is performed in the category (paragraph 36-37).

Regarding Claim 20, Lee et al (US 20090170532) discloses the at least one processor is further configured to detect the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 36), determine the category of the location information of the electronic device (paragraph 48), determine an operation mapped to the category (paragraph 47), and perform the operation (paragraph 47).
